greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest difference>1 between d and p/d for any divisor d of the partial product p of the sequence, starting with 4.
comment: a(n) is a power of two for n>1 and log_2(a(n))=A073941(n) for n>2. - _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 16 20.
link: R. Stephan, [math/0305348] On a sequence related to the Josephus problem
Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
program: (PARI) p=4; print1(p, ", "); for(n=1, 50, v=divisors(p); r=sqrt(p); t=0; for(k=1, matsize(v)[2], if(v[k]>=r, t=k; break)); if(v[t]^2==p, u=t, u=t-1); if(v[t]-v[u]<2, u=u-1; t=t+1); print1(v[t]-v[u]", "); p=p*(v[t]-v[u]))
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Apr 04 2003
